intro: Corydalis taipaishanica, commonly known as the Taipaishan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
